crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
When checking on the overall status of HTTP data, the issetHTTP() method of the http_manager :: class will return TRUE or FALSE depending on the existence of data in the request method type. This method accepts only a single parameter...the $_GET or $_POST super global.
For a more granular approach to determining the availability of $_POST or $_GET data, the issetParam() method of the http_manager :: class will return TRUE or FALSE depending on the availability of data within the specified HTTP request method type ($_GET or $_POST).
The issetParam() method...which is being documented here..., requires one additional parameter...the $name of the variable that is being stored in the super global.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latest gains in security and processing efficiency.
Currently tested on an ubuntu 4.2 server running PHP Version 5.2.6 and Apache 2.2.11

crnrstn_parameter.crnrstn_paramdefinition: The name of the variable within the specified HTTP request method that needs to have its data extracted from the respective super global.
The $_POST or $_GET super global of the HTTP request method containing the data that is to be extracted.
